question: What is highlighted in the Amnesty International Annual Report 2022-2023?
phrase: Encouraging signs and setbacks in the global fight against death penalty penalties.
predAns: The judicial use of the death penalty for the period January to December 2022
oriLLMans: [The judicial use of the death penalty for the period January to December 2022]; [2, 7].
oriSent: The Amnesty International Annual Report 2022-2023 has highlighted both encouraging signs and setbacks in the global fight against death penalty penalties.

question: How many countries have abolished the death penalty in law or practice according to the report?
predAns: More than two-thirds of the countries in the world have now abolished the death penalty in law or practice.
oriLLMans: [More than two-thirds of the countries in the world have now abolished the death penalty in law or practice.]; [1, 2, 6]
oriSent: With 106 countries having abolished the death penalty in law or practice, the report highlights the progress made towards the universal abolition of the death penalty.

question: What is one example of increased abolitionist momentum mentioned in the report?
phrase: Mongolia abolishing the death penalty in July
predAns: African leaders and abolitionists hold anti-death penalty summit in Cotonou
oriLLMans: African leaders and abolitionists hold anti-death penalty summit in Cotonou; [7].
oriSent: In the past year, several countries have taken steps towards abolition, including Mongolia, which abolished the death penalty in July.

question: How much have executions worldwide declined according to the report?
predAns: Executions worldwide increased in 2022, with at least 883 recorded, marking a 53% increase from 2021. This figure represents the highest number of executions in a single year since 2022
oriLLMans: Executions worldwide increased in 2022, with at least 883 recorded, marking a 53% increase from 2021. This figure represents the highest number of executions in a single year since 2022; [6].
oriSent: The report notes that the number of executions worldwide has declined significantly in the past year. According to Amnesty International, at least 2,300 people were executed in 2022, a decrease of 35% compared to the previous year.

question: What does the report highlight regarding the treatment of those facing the death penalty?
phrase: The growing attention to human rights and dignity
predAns: The report highlights double standards on human rights and the failure of the international community to unite around universal values
oriLLMans: The report highlights double standards on human rights and the failure of the international community to unite around universal values; [2].
oriSent: The report highlights the growing attention to human rights in the context of the death penalty. Many countries have recognized the inherent dignity of all human beings and have taken steps to ensure that those facing the death penalty are treated with respect and dignity.

question: What is one example of a setback mentioned in the report?
phrase: Resurgence of the death penalty in some countries
